parametrized_description: An individual consumes vegetables and fruits. A serving of vegetables contains VegetableVitamins units of vitamins and VegetableMinerals units of minerals. A serving of fruits contains FruitVitamins units of vitamins and FruitMinerals units of minerals. The individual requires at least MinimumVitamins units of vitamins and MinimumMinerals units of minerals. Vegetables cost VegetableCost per serving and fruits cost FruitCost per serving. Determine the number of servings of each to minimize total cost.

VegetableVitamins.description: Amount of vitamins in one serving of vegetables

VegetableMinerals.description: Amount of minerals in one serving of vegetables

FruitVitamins.description: Amount of vitamins in one serving of fruits

FruitMinerals.description: Amount of minerals in one serving of fruits

VegetableServings.description: The number of servings of vegetables

FruitServings.description: The number of servings of fruits

constraints.description: A serving of vegetables contains VegetableVitamins units of vitamins and a serving of fruits contains FruitVitamins units of vitamins. The individual requires at least MinimumVitamins units of vitamins.

A serving of vegetables contains VegetableMinerals units of minerals and a serving of fruits contains FruitMinerals units of minerals. The individual requires at least MinimumMinerals units of minerals.

objective.description: Total cost is the sum of VegetableCost per serving of vegetables and FruitCost per serving of fruits. The objective is to minimize the total cost while meeting the minimum nutrient requirements.
